subject: Re: [junit] Wrapping external tests within JUnit 4
msgSnippet: I also had same issue with JUnit 4 i.e.; running individual TestCases in JUnit4 I you found any solution please reply to me immediatley. thanks, Rajesh Gottapu

From: Arnaud Bailly <arnaud.oqube@...>
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Tuesday, 16 December, 2008 9:38:36 PM
Subject: Re: [junit] Wrapping external tests within JUnit 4


Hello David,
What I want to do is the equivalent of the following code:

@Override
public void run(TestResult result) {
HtmlUnitDriver driver = new HtmlUnitDriver( );
driver.setJavascrip tEnabled( true);
File f = new File(basedir) ;
driver.get("file:///" + f.getAbsolutePath( ) + "/target/test- classes/"
+ this.testHtml) ;
List<WebElement> tests =
driver.findElements (By.xpath( "//ol[@id= 'tests']/ li"));
for (WebElement element : tests) {
JQTest jqTest = new JQTest(element) ;
jqTest.run(result) ;
}
driver.quit( );
}

public static TestSuite suite() {
TestSuite ts = new TestSuite();
ts.addTest(new JQUnitTest(" test-etatflash" ));
return ts;
}

but using JUnit 4 API.

I just wrap some non JUnit tests into JUnit tests, using TestResult to
pass the results along.

Thanks
Arnaud
